radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is inflamed with hyperemic and thickened walls and dilated lumen measuring up to 10 mm. There is associated trace amount of ascites and fat stranding around the inflamed appendix. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. The liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small bowel loops are all unremarkable and without lesions. No evidence of abscess or perforation.
